english.segment3: [This lesson is entitled: The Facts of Life.]
english.segment4: It's time you finally listen to the things I have to say. I've been talking with no response. It's time for your attention. Are you ready to listen?. Now listen for what you've missed every time before."
english.segment5: "In this conversation with the known unknown, Mouth shut, eyes wide, ready and willing."
english.segment6: "I've let open the skies this very night."
english.segment7: "I'll sit and wait while the stars they take their time. Because I'm starved with empty hands, and I've been, I've been a broken man. Oh pilot of pilots come fly me home. I'm coming, coming to say goodnight. If I have one more day to live. Then I have one more day to fight.
english.segment8: Sometimes it's just too hard to make myself believe, That you'll catch me when I fall."
english.segment9: "Don't let them make you think, let them make you think your doubt disbelief."
english.segment10: "I'm not about to pretend to be something that I'm not."
english.segment11: ["Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapor that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away." Life is, indeed, fleeting.]
